page.title: 15Churches and ethnic groups
page.content: Liverpool is home to a cosmopolitan, multi-racial, multi-faith society. This is best exhibited in the two cathedrals, which dominate the city skyline. We decided to find out how many different types of churches exist in our immediate area. In a road close to our school is a {Jewish synagogue. }Off Aigburth Road, near to Garston Docks, we found the {Norwegian Seamen's Church. }Nearer to the city, along Princes Park Road is a {Greek Orthodox church,}and a{Methodist {centre.} Along Woolton road there is a {Welsh chapel}and as you approach the city, along Edge Lane another chapel has now been converted into a{Hindu {temple.}This is to say nothing of the usual {Church of England }and {Roman {Catholic}churches which may be found as in any other town or city.
